title: Admiral Byrd said there was a land mass bigger than America beyond the South Pole that has never been explored.. How is this possible? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the geocentric theory it’s quite feasible there is more land beyond the Antarctic which encircles the earth and keeps water in an observable and logical flat level, water always conforms to this never around a globe and gravitational theories are inconsistent with reality. Ancient maps are seen to have more land although maybe not accurate indicate so, this is purportedly a Buddhist one:  The ancient Vedic cosmology is geocentric (as are all civilisations apart from our modern one) – a flat plane with millions of miles (measured in Sanskrit yojanas) of land beyond the portion we call ‘earth’. One of my videos visualised the description in the Puranas:  Admiral Byrd died untimely shortly after these missions, suspicious to many of us, and the Antarctic Treaty was set in place by the UN. It infers hiding what is truly there in that region under the guise of environmental concern. If the rest of the earth was so protected from industry/military it would be miraculous!

Harish Ram explained it very well. Too many people think that the South Pole is a region, but Admiral Byrd knew it was an exact point. And he was also exactly right about the large land mass of East Antarctica. Much of the exploration to that time was in the much smaller West Antarctica. During the 1950s and 1960s there were several bases built around the coast of East Antarctica, but exploring the interior was very difficult, as it is both high and cold. Relatively few expeditions ventured into that area, although the Soviet Union built a station in the middle: Vostok. There is nothing mysterious about Admiral Byrd’s remarks. He was being geographically and factually accurate about Antarctica. What he referred to is now known as East Antarctica. And it is bigger than the continental US.

As a matter of interest, I spent a year at the geographic South Pole. This was at the previous, domed station, not the new station on stilts. We had under glass in our small library a PhD dissertation from the Univ. of Calif. with the premise that instead of a South Pole, the Earth had an opening at the south axis granting entry into the Earth’s interior. The writer claimed that Adm. Byrd actually flew into this opening, and what he found was the vast land he referred to in the quote. For the 18 of us who wintered over that winter at the South Pole itself, this PhD dissertation was a wonderful joke, and a distraction from the hardship of the winter-over. (In the photo, I’m the 4th from the right in the back row, wearing a head-band.)

What Admiral Byrd said was true when he said it in 1954. The size of the land mass remains true - it was a reasonable estimate. That it has never been explored is no longer true. Admiral Byrd went to the point of the Geographic South Pole from his base camp at “Little America” on the edge of the Ross Ice Shelf:  His statement that there was unexplored land for 1000 miles, or land the size of the USA on the far side of the pole from “Little America” was a fair claim. Here are two maps of the same scale overlaid:  You can see that, by now, much if not all of this area has been explored by different countries.

500 pound penguins attack anyone who sets foot on the land there .There is an operation planned to send a force of combat experienced troops lead by none other than Carlos Danger to defeat the peguins and place them in confined areas so that research can be conducted. The research team was to be under the supervision of Jeff Epstein consisting the brightest Harvard professors but the plan was called off by Whitehead on CNN once Epstein escaped his cell in NYC. this info was found on Russian BOTs HDs.

it explains itself if you look at a map that traces Byrd’s expedition. He took the shortest path from the coast to the Pole, and when he arrived to the Pole, he effectively could see part of East Antarctica, a region that was largely unexplored by that time, where there are international bases today. In other words, he went through the smallest part of Antarctica, reach the pole and stood before the largest part of the continent beyond the scope of his comparatively short his expedition. Hope this helps.

The Antarctic contains the largest (ice) desert in the world. As a result of the extreme cold the air can hold little or no water vapor. So the interior of the Antarctic gets no precipitation. Unlike the Arctic (North Pole), there is a land mass beneath the ice in the Antarctic. It is a fragment of the original land mass known as Pangea. There is much to be explored in the Antarctic.

Harish Ram got the basics. The area nearly pinched off by the Weddell and Ross Seas roughly cuts Antarctica in two. The part in west longitude is called West Antarctica and the rest, mostly east longitude, is called East Antarctica. Byrd was referring to East Antarctica. From a U.S. perspective, that’s “beyond the South Pole.”

Admiral Byrd said there was a land mass bigger than America beyond the South Pole that has never been explored.. How is this possible? It is a fable often repeated by loony tunes who believe in the “Hollow Earth Theory”.

He was referring to the areas on the “eastern" side of the Antarctic continent. Little America on the western side was some 800 miles from the south pole. There was a huge area to the east in Byrd's day which was totally unknown

response.answer_text: I think it is not possible. The earth is visible to space craft, and there is only very cold areas at the South Pole. It is land there, under the ice and snow, unlike the North Pole.
